title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date specified in the bill. It also addresses personal injury or death of seamen. The Act amends Section 30104 of title 46, United States Code, allowing injured seamen or their representatives to bring actions for personal injury or death under US laws. Venue for such actions at law will be in the judicial district where the employer resides. The Act amends Section 53701 of title 46, United States Code, to redefine terms like Administrator and Secretary. It also modifies Section 53706(c) to prioritize certain vessels for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act of 2003. The Act prioritizes vessels eligible for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act of 2003, giving preference to those constructed with assistance under subtitle D and vessels suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency. The Secretary of Defense must make a determination within 30 days of a request from the Administrator. Section 53707 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to include the Administrator in certain subsections. Section 53707 of title 46, United States Code is amended to include the Administrator in certain subsections, with changes such as inserting "Administrator" after "Secretary" and replacing references to the "Secretary of Transportation" with "Administrator." Section 53708 is also amended to replace references to the "Secretary" with "Administrator" and remove mentions of the "Secretary of Transportation" and "of Commerce." Section 53708 of title 46, United States Code is amended to replace references to the "Secretary" with "Administrator" and remove mentions of the "Secretary of Transportation" and "of Commerce." This includes changes in subsections (a), (b), (c), (d), and (e) to ensure that independent analysis of risk factors is conducted by a private sector expert selected by the Secretary or Administrator. Section 53712(b) of title 46, United States Code is amended to include requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in the loan agreement if a requirement has been waived by the Secretary or Administrator under section 53707(d). Subsections (c) and (d) of section 53717 are also amended to remove references to the "Secretary of Commerce." The text discusses amendments to various sections of title 46, United States Code, including changes to references of the "Secretary" to "Administrator" in specific provisions. Amendments are made to various sections of title 46, United States Code, changing references from "Secretary" to "Administrator" in specific provisions. Amendments to sections of title 46, United States Code change references from "Secretary" to "Administrator" in specific provisions. Sections 53701(1), (4), and (9), 53702(a), 53703, 53704, 53706(a)(3)(B)(iii), 53709(a)(1), (b)(1) and (2)(A), and (d), 53710(a) and (c), 53711, 53712 (except the last place it appears), 53713 to 53716, 53721 to 53725, and 53734 are affected. Sections 53715(d)(1), 53716(d)(3), 53721(c), 53722(a)(1) and (b)(1)(B), and 53724(b) are also amended. SEC. 4. MISCELLANEOUS AMENDMENTS. Title 46, United States Code, is amended by changing "Naval Reserve" to "Navy Reserve" in chapters 513 and 515. Section 51504(f) is amended to specify fuel cost payments to State maritime academies. The maximum payment amounts are set for fiscal years 2006-2008 and beyond. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is also amended to adjust payment limits for State maritime academies. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is amended to increase payment limits for State maritime academies to $300,000 for fiscal year 2006, $400,000 for fiscal year 2007, and $500,000 for fiscal year 2008 and beyond. Section 51701(a) is amended to include functions to assist the United States merchant marine as determined necessary by the Secretary. Section 51907 is amended to allow the Secretary of Transportation to provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized by the chapter. Chapter 541, titled "Assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities," is inserted after chapter 539. Section 3506 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006 is transferred and redesignated as section 54101 of title 46, United States Code. The heading of section 54101 is amended to reflect its new title. Section 55101(b) is amended by inserting "or" after paragraph (2), striking paragraph (3), and redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3). Section 60301 is amended to adjust tonnage fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and thereafter. Section 60301 is amended to adjust tonnage fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and thereafter, increasing to 13.5 cents per ton, not exceeding 67.5 cents per ton per year, for the specified period, and then decreasing to 6 cents per ton, not exceeding 30 cents per ton per year, for subsequent fiscal years. SEC. 5. REPEALS. The following provisions are repealed, except for rights, duties, penalties, or proceedings before the enactment of this Act. The Statutes at Large list various public laws and sections, including those from 1936 and 2006. In 2006, public laws and sections were listed in the Statutes at Large, including provisions related to 515(g)(2), 3502, 3507(a)-(c)(3), 3509, and 3510. On Jan. 6, provisions 119, 3236, 3547, 3555, and 3557 were highlighted. On Feb. 8, provisions 120 and 27 were mentioned. The Act will only be effective if H.R. 1442 in the 109th Congress is enacted, becoming effective immediately after its enactment.
